learning_outcomes.description: Apply interdisciplinary knowledge to critically analyse and solve complex real-world industry problems in an innovative manner.
Demonstrate professional practice, project management, consultancy, and group work skills through collaborative problem solving.
Persuasively pitch and defend business solutions and recommendations in relation to the industry partner's problem.
Present a business report that reflects continuous feedback and delivers a viable solution to the industry problem.
Critically evaluate your strengths and areas for growth, considering team interactions and project execution.

assessments.task_description:
In the opening stage of the project your project team will demonstrate foundational planning for the execution of the project. You and your team will prepare and present your team setup arrangements (communication, collaboration/meetings, rules, conflict resolution strategies, reflection, quality control, etc.), as well as a preliminary project plan (scope of work, work breakdown structure, team member roles and responsibilities, project timeline, milestones, risk contingency plan, etc.).

This task reflects standard project initiation practices in industry, where teams establish ways of working and develop formal project plans that are essential for effective project delivery.

Assessment criteria will cover team setup decisions and the application of project planning principles and methods.

assessments.task_description:
In this assessment, you will critically reflect on your project’s progression and execution, highlighting key incidents/moments/challenges/successes. You will draw lessons from your and your team’s planning and management of the project. You will also evaluate your individual contributions, the skills and attributes you demonstrated, and areas for personal development.

This task will help you build reflective habits that support effective teamwork and accountability. It mirrors common workplace practices such as project debriefs, lessons-learned reviews, and professional development planning.

Assessment criteria will assess students’ ability to identify and describe relevant critical incidents or moments, critically analyse those incidents or moments, and articulate the personal and professional lessons derived.

Failure to present to the industry partner on the agreed date and time will be indicative of gross professional failure and will result in a mark of zero.
assessments.task_description:
The project culminates in the delivery of a client presentation and final report containing your project team’s research, analysis and recommendations.

  • A3.1: The client presentation will be a distilled version of the report, delivered via PowerPoint, either in-person or through video conferencing, depending on the client’s preferences. You will take responsibility for and present part of the presentation, on which you will be individually assessed. Assessment criteria will cover organisation and clarity of information, use of audio-visual aids, oral delivery, and strength of arguments.
  • A3.2: The final report will be an industry standard document containing a complete account of the work of the project team, including methodology, data collected, analysis and findings/recommendations. Assessment criteria will cover report structure, writing quality, analysis and findings, and use of visual aids.

This is a group task, and a peer assessment factor will be applied to the grade for the final report.
